Reviews.Title: fujifilm finepix z30 Orange
Reviews.Author: B. Elias
Reviews.Content: I just ordered this camera and got it today.  I was a little nervous ordering a camera that was just released and had no reviews, but the fujifilm finepix z20 had such good reviews, that I decided to take a chance on the newer model.So far everything is perfect.  The battery charged quickly and setup was very simple.  This camera is so easy to use, which is important to me, since I'm kind of technology-challenged.  With most cameras, I have trouble navigating the menu, but this camera is very simple to work.  Also, the screen on the back is very large, to make viewing the pictures easy.  There is one great feature on the camera that I really like.  There is a setting that when activated, will always take two pictures every time you snap a picture.  One with a flash and one without, and store both for you to view.  This way you never have to worry about your pictures being too dark or too bright.  The pictures are crystal clear, and I'm very glad I've purchased this camera.I can't comment on the software, as I haven't used it yet, but everything else has been great.

Reviews.Title: Bargain Compact
Reviews.Author: E. J Tastad "ejt"
Reviews.Content: Pros:Compact SizeQuality FeelSliding lens cover doubles as power switchFast LCD refresh (must be 60 hz, but only in high performance mode)Weather Sealed buttonsCons:Battery LifeNo full manual modeOnly 3x optical zoomNo optical shake reductionBottom Line: Great value for a quality feeling budget compact camera.  Image quality is fine, I see no problems with smaller prints up to ISO 800, this is far better than my previous point and shoot that was half the resolution.  My favorite features are the weather sealed buttons (the camera isn't weather sealed, get the Z33wp for that), but the buttons are rubber covered and liquid can't get in around them, and my other favorite feature is the high frame update on the LCD.  As long as you set the menu option for high performance, the rear LCD updates very rapidly, any motion is updated instantly.  This is much improved over most of the competition, but no reviews I see mention this.Some people are complaining about the quality of the images, but either they have a bad sample or are just viewing the images at 100% on a computer monitor.  Prints are fine.  I will comment that the rear LCD is sometimes grainy appearing, but the final images are great.  This is because the rear LCD has a high frame update, about 60 hz, and it needs to set the sensitivity very high in low light in order to show you an image at that rate, so the display comes grainy.  When you take the picture it is fine.Overall this is a pretty average performing camera that is inexpensive.  It has a semi manual mode for setting your own ISO, EV compensation, but it lacks a few other options.  The aperture just uses a couple values, and can't be selected manually.  If you can pick this up for about a hundred bucks it is a bargain.  If you get up near one hundred fifty there are probably better options available.Update: I found the condition people must be getting grainy pictures.  This camera doesn't have a powerful flash, and in a large room trying to take a picture of a subject maybe 15 or 20 ft away the flash doesn't have the power to illuminate them adequately.  If you use this indoors in a dim room, it is fine at close range, but not great for a Christmas program or a picture of a presenter across the room.  In these situations you might try disabling the flash.

Reviews.Title: You will LOVE this camera...
Reviews.Author: Sara J. Stricherz "SaraInSeattle"
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect, exactly what I wanted.  It looks even better in person!!  I've used it out on the town, inside with flourescent lighting, and outdoors, and it's definitely 10.1 megapixels of AWESOME.  You can read about all its details above (it's red-eye removal, video capabilities, etc).. but here are the items I wasn't sure about when I ordered the camera from Amazon, but was proved wrong:1) The camera looks expensive, NOT cheap.  I was worried about the little stones looking feminine or cheap, but they're very tiny and does NOT make the camera look "girly".2) The sliding door is a great idea, because it protects the lens, and makes the camera ready to GO once you open it!  Normally cameras take 10 seconds to ready to shoot (power.. ok, adjust, click, hold, wait..) Not this camera!  You open the door, click the button, and view the picture within 3 seconds.  It's so nice!  Plus, it's ready to go AFTER taking a picture much more quickly.3) The sliding door has a nice "click" so don't worry about it opening up in your purse/pocket... really.  It's fine.4) I love the buttons on the back of the camera--they're larger than other cameras, easy to read and press, looks more modern, etc.So... BUY THIS CAMERA!  You'll love it!

Reviews.Title: Sharp Pictures, Grainy LCD Display
Reviews.Author: Stephanie
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this product, turns out it did not come with an Owner's Manual or Installation CD. When I first saw it I loved the color (Orange) and small, sleek style. I snapped a few pictures which looked grainy on the LCD screen- I quickly turned to the online reviews and found out this is a common complaint of this camera.. HOWEVER, once you download them onto your computer they look amazing. Well worth it for the price!I love the flip open cover seeing as our last camera got sand in the zoo lens and ended up never working the same. This added protection is great!One other thing that made this a 4 out of 5 star rating is having to use the USB cable to upload pictures onto the computer, which I do quite frequently. And the fact that it does not take a "normal" battery, so make sure you order an extra and keep the one it comes with charging when not in use.Overall a wonderful camera for the price and style.

Reviews.Title: All in all, not bad...
Reviews.Author: Floyd Goodrich "Jim G."
Reviews.Content: Just received this camera for my teenage granddaughter so I charged up the battery, set the camera to its highest and best settings, installed a 4GB SD card and took some sample pictures and a sample video. The picture taken outdoors was very good, sharp, clear and colorful. The picture taken inside using the flash was more grainy than it should have been as compared to my other cameras of this general P/S type, hence the loss of a star. The video this camera takes is another story, its first rate, clear, colorful, and very smooth with very good sound. Its a good camera, not great, but very small and easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great value, great features AND easy to use!
Reviews.Author: N. Douglas "Nicked1"
Reviews.Content: I have looked a Fujifilm cameras for 2 years now and decided to take the plunge.  I love this camera.  It is eons ahead of Kodak and even the popular Nikon in the same class.  Both of which I already own.  The low light pictures are great!  One of my frustrations with the above mention brands was that I couldn't take clear pictures of my childs performances(inside a dim gymnasium)  I missed so many great shots.  This camera makes it happen!!  Wow!  Don't second guess, just pick out your favorite color and go for it!  A great deal for the $$$ too!

Reviews.Title: Not bad for my fashion-conscious daughter
Reviews.Author: mjpatey
Reviews.Content: Quality-wise, it's about what you'd expect for the money.  Images are not stunning by any means, but certainly serviceable.  There's no reason this should use a 10 megapixel sensor; the optics of the camera are not up to par with that resolution.  Indoor shots without flash are a mixed bag, though the camera does make it pretty easy to turn the flash on and off.  Bright outdoor shots do look good, as they do with most cameras.The video feature actually surprised me; it's quite good!  I haven't examined it too closely, but the video quality gives my portable Flip video camcorder a run for its money.All in all, this has been a decent purchase.  My daughter now has a nice, easy point-and-shoot camera that looks cool (pink!!!), and we're not too much poorer as a result.

Reviews.Title: im impressed !
Reviews.Author: Mar "Marinera"
Reviews.Content: i just got this camera i took a few pictures of my son and i just love how it came out ! so sharp pics and colorful !i love the pink and i love everything except the usb is inside the battery and its a pain to dowload pictures.but i got this camera for really cheap and its nice and fast !i do recommend this camera for everybody ! nice and little to carry in your pocketpssorry my english. some people with no life comes in my post and insults me and think because i dont write good english makes them better. but they not better because they only ignorant people inmature and dont kwnow another language, just dirt

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Bocker Brodie "cbrodie5"
Reviews.Content: Got this just the other day. Love that's it's small and takes good pictures. Only bad thing is the pause between pictures. But we can deal with that.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic pocket-size camera!! So handy we now own two!!
Reviews.Author: K. Salinger "FNP, RN"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my 5 year old daughter, who had been begging for a "real" camera for quite some time. We were preparing for a trip to Costa Rica and it seemed the perfect time for such a gift.Well I must say that we just returned from our trip yesterday and here I am now ordering this exact same camera for myself!Both my husband and I were highly impressed with the ease of use and great pictures this camera takes. Granted - if you see yourself as some consummate photographer this is not the unit for yo - but for your average person who wants great pictures without having to fiddle with various focusing mechanisms, fancy settings, etc. this unit is perfect!I took over my little girl's brand new camera to some extent because it was just so easy to use. By the time my husband would have his more expensive camera ready to snap I had taken several snaps on this little gem of a camera - it was great!! It has many features we didn't use - pretty much just straight forward pictures and the zoom feature was it. However just with that our holiday pictures are great. We inserted a 2GB card and took about 380 pictures and there seemed to be room for several hundred more. We were gone for 12 days, took pictures at least 9-10 days of that and only used 1/3 of the battery or so. We didn't use the software as we just insert the memory card into our laptops to upload, so can't comment on any of that.One feature that I found especially invaluable is the built in lens cover which also functions as the on/off for the camera (camera on when you open it, camera off when you close). The beauty is that the camera lens is protected without the bother of having to use a camera case. You can carry this camera in your pocket, in your purse, on your wrist or in hand without any worry of damage. When you want to use it you just slide open the lens cover & snap your quick picture. There is no fuss or bother with a case and no long warm up period - it's essentially ready to go when you open the lens cover to turn it on. This feature quick snaps while on the go and other spur of the moment pictures incredibly easy. I didn't have to worry about damaging the lens (and especially so, I didn't have to worry about my 5 y.o. daughter damaging the lens)At one point during our trip my 5 year old wasn't paying attention and feel down pretty hard off a curb - camera and all smashing to the pavement. The camera took a what seemed to be a hard hit on the pavement and we thought for sure it would be broken. Nope! The camera now has a little brown permanent scar on one corner from the fall, but otherwise it is completely fine. Had it not had the built in lens cover it likely would have been seriously damaged for sure, as the front is what hit when she fell.You know why I love this thing, but what about my original purpose of having this a camera for my 5 year old?!? Well, for those considering it for kids, My 5 y.o. daughter LOVES this camera. It has been easy for her to use and carry and she loves that it isn't goofy or clunky like most kids cameras. It's also great that it takes tons of pictures as you'll likely get some odd stuff based on a 5 y/o's idea of great pictures (lovely curbs, stitching on a bedspread, dirt, and so on...). I recommend it for responsible little ones who will be able to remember to shut the lens cover (which is easy since that turns it off) after each shot to protect the lens. The point and shoot aspect is so easy even a 3 y.o. can use this camera.All-in-all, this is a GREAT camera for responsible and smart little ones in addition to being a GREAT camera for adults! Our whole family is impressed and we will shortly own two of these once mine arrives.

Reviews.Title: I purchased this for a gift, but I kept it for myself
Reviews.Author: Yarii
Reviews.Content: *****ETA:  I love this camera but I decided to just give it to my nephew instead; the more I experimented with it, I did not care for the USB plug-in to be located inside the battery compartment.  It's a fine camera otherwise.  Instead, I bought this one for myself - Fujifilm FinePix Z70 12 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)*****This was intended for a young relative of mine - since this camera has an optical zoom lens in the internal style, I thought it would be a safer camera for little ones to use, in case it is dropped.  More on that later!  And the whirl white color scheme is perfect for young kids.But after testing the camera to make sure it was ok prior to gifting it, I fell in love with the Z30 myself.  Now I'll have to go and buy another - I'm partial to Fuji cameras and I couldn't pass up the great price on this one. This is my 8th Fuji camera purchased since 2004, I love them.The Z30 is TINY - and the screen is big and bright - I have no trouble seeing anything on this LCD screen even outside in bright sunlight.  It's tiny and lightweight and easy to carry in either a pocket or small bag.And since the lens has a cover - and this is the way the camera is powered on/off - by sliding the lens cover open (like the first Fuji digital cameras) you almost don't need to buy a separate case....although I do keep mine in a case because I don't like the exterior to get scratched.A couple of complaints for an almost-perfect entry level camera:>>>  The USB port is located inside the battery compartment.  I don't know why they couldn't have designed it for the side of the camera like most others.  I'm afraid of opening flimsy battery compartments unless I absolutely have to.  Even if I want to use my SD card reader instead of transferring photos via the USB cord, I still have to open this compartment.>>>  There is no good location to grip the camera on the back of the camera.  The entire area is composed of LCD screen and buttons.  At least the back area of the camera is rubberized so it does help with the gripping.But the pro's way outnumber my complaints:>>>  Quick response when opening the lens cover to take the first shot>>>  Takes beautiful life-like color-saturated pictures>>>  Fast response time after taking a flash picture>>>  Takes good videos - better than my expensive Panasonic Lumix>>>  Love the auction setting for grouping shots together in 1 frame>>>  SR Auto - there's no thinking, just point and shoot>>>  Lithium-ion battery - the charge lasts for weeksOne "pro" which I want to take the time to make stand out among the previous is I love that this camera enables you to choose standard color, saturated color, and even black & white photos.Choosing the saturated color setting (which is accessed through the Shooting Menu Options), produces almost the same effect as what Canon advertises as the "Poster Effect" on its new line of Canon A495 cameras  Canon PowerShot A495 10.1 MP Digital Camera with 3.3x Optical Zoom and 2.5-Inch LCD (Red).  You can make some really nice wall art by choosing this setting and tweaking it a bit with Picasa.Bottom Line: This Fuji is a good entry-level camera and I recommend it for just about anyone that is looking for an easy to use digital camera (even young children) AND it's built tougher than it appears.  Case in point:  Two days after I received this, I was sitting at my kitchen table when it slipped out of my hands and hit the floor (my condo is built on a slab).  I thought the camera was broken, but I turned it back on and it's none worse for the wear.  Not even a scratch.

Reviews.Title: Finepix Z30
Reviews.Author: Lilac Lily
Reviews.Content: I got the white and black edition of this camera, and I really love the stylish look of it. Wben I first opened the package though, I was a bit taken aback by the small size of this camera. It's hardly bigger than the palm of my hand. I guess, I had been so used to my old camera(and I mean really old), that this Fujifilm camera seemed tiny in comparison. I have gotten used to it now, and I love the fact that it's small enough to fit in your jeans pocket. However, I would suggest a nice case for the camera, just because it seems a bit fragile.There is no seperate viewer on this camera, it only has the large 2.7" LCD display which is all I ever use anyway. You have the ability to take 10MP pictures, but if you don't need that many megapixels (say, if you don't really want to enlarge your pics a lot) you have the option to set the megapixels from anywhere between 2MP's -10MP's. I really like that option because taking all your pictures with 10 megapixels does take up a lot of space on your computer or SD card. Also, you can make longer videos than the stated 60seconds when you reduce the megapixels.Another thing I would like to mention is that this camera included a battery and battery charger. For some reason I couldn't find any information about that on the product page when I placed my order, and thus I bought another battery and charger. This might be obvious to some people but it wasn't to me so I thought I'd mention it here. The picture quality seems pretty good so far, especially when you have plenty of light. The flash isn't great and pictures of distant objects in a darker room do not come out very well. Overall, I think it's a great buy and I would highly recommend it.UPDATE: After taking this camera on a little trip and taking plenty of pictures I just wanted to add some more information. I actually had to remove two stars from my original rating because all of the pictures that I took inside or in areas without a lot of bright light came out grainy, blurry and with very dull colors. I was pretty disappointed about that. The only time the pictures came out right was when I was taking them outside with plenty of bright sunshine. This is not what I was expecting at all and I can't really recommend this camera anymore.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Jlovelace "JL"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my 13 year old daughter.  She got a, "Nicer," model for Christmas and broke it in 3 days.  She loves this camera and hasn't broke it since we got it 4 months ago.  The pictures turn out really crisp and she enjoys being able to upload them with no assistance.  It is easy to use and offers some great features.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my uses
Reviews.Author: Clare White "Clare"
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for me. I've had it for a month or so now, so I can't attest to its durability yet, but I have used it a LOT already. I took it with me on a spring break trip and found that it is small enough for my pocket, easy to use, and takes great pictures. It has a good strong flash, and I really noticed this while I was taking pictures for someone else with their camera in a dark room. I really like how quickly it turns on - other people missed picture moments waiting for their cameras to start up, but this one was fast enough 90% of the time. I like how quickly the camera is ready to take another picture - under one second (when the battery is low, it seems to take longer). The image does appear grainy on the screen, but it looks great once you get it on the computer. Several people commented on the large size of the viewing screen. I liked the waterproof buttons - I did wind up working in wet, muddy areas, and this camera was fine. I took almost 250 pictures over break, and I have to do very little editing on them - resize, sometimes crop, and it's ready to go. I got great pictures of a beaver dam a long way off; the zoom served me well and it came out very clear when I cropped and resized it. I have wonderful pictures from this trip - indoors, outdoors, dark rooms, bright areas, people, animals, nature, architecture, gardens, action, still... I'm in love with this little camera!I went through both of my batteries (buy a spare, they're handy) and had to recharge one during the five-day trip, but that's probably because I spent at least a third of every day with it in my hand.Three things I noticed:1. It won't turn on while it's plugged into the computer to upload unless the original battery is in. When I use the extra one that I bought separately, it won't upload. Maybe this is an issue with the particular battery I received or the type of battery I bought (GT Max Battery Pack for FUNP-45 3.6V Li-ion), but it could definitely be an issue with the camera. But considering how great of a camera this is all around, I don't mind too much.2. If you're not careful, you will bump the lens cover (which doubles as an on-off switch) and turn the camera off while you're viewing your pictures. When you've just sorted through 100+ photos to find that one image and you accidentally turn it off, that's a pain! Again, not a big issue - I figured out finally that by pressing and holding the arrow buttons, you can move through the pictures much faster.3. The video function is a little difficult to figure out... Or maybe that's just me.I highly recommend this camera to someone like me, who takes pictures only for fun, wants fairly high-quality images, and has a budget of under $100. I don't recommend it to someone who wants really first-class pictures, like an art/photography student - this is not for artists, it's for very casual hobbyists and amateurs, like me.

Reviews.Title: Great for its size
Reviews.Author: P. D. Lueken
Reviews.Content: I've had very good luck with this little camera. I purchased it because it was so small and would fit in my pocket, out of sight of my 18 month old grandson I recently visited. My second grandson, his brother, was born just two weeks ago and I was hoping to get some great shots of the two of them together. Since it's not good to use a flash around little ones, especially newborns, I turned it off and was surprised at the quality of the indoor photos and videos. Granted, there were a few blurry ones when I didn't wait for the camera to focus first, or he didn't hold still long enough, but the majority were amazing. Outside photos and videos were crisp and clear and the playback on the videos was smooth and synched with the sound. Battery usage was minimal - I spent a week taking picture after picture, video after video and never had to charge the battery. When I got home and checked, it was only one-third used up. Awesome for such a small camera. I had tried the Kodak C180 and couldn't even get the settings adjusted without using a third of the batteries.Needless to say, I am very pleased with this camera. It does a great job as a point-and-shoot, is extremely portable, uses very little battery and takes great videos as well. For the price, it's worth a try.

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera
Reviews.Author: M. Haus "mschelsy"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  We purchased it two weeks ago and have had some time to work with it.  The picture quality is great.  It adjusts to any lighting situation, it has a number of features we have not learned all of them yet but seem simple enough.  I'm not a professional but for the time we use it we are happy with it.  The fact that it fits in your pocket and is about the size of your cell phone is the biggest reason we bought it.  Hope you enjoy it as well.

Reviews.Title: FujiFilm not reliable
Reviews.Author: J. Shaw
Reviews.Content: I bought this early for my daughter for her birthday.  She is an adult and has taken photography in college.  This camera was used 2 times and now it won't work.  We got it exactly 32 days ago and it now will not work at all.  The display screen is just a bunch of jumbled lines.  Don't buy this camera!  Amazon will not replace it and you have to pay to have it sent to a repair center.  So therefore you won't have a camera!  Fuji won't even talk to us.  Their only suggestion is send it to the repair center and you have the option of getting a refurbished one, yeah right that's going to make me feel better.  Their product is so bad, they expect to get it back!  This camera has been sitting on a table for a month except for being used twice.  It is in perfect condition, it just doesn't work.I am so disappointed in Amazon and also Fuji.  My daughter now has no birthday present and no camera to take with her on her trip. I will never buy another Fuji product again and will not be buying from Amazon either since you cannot return defective merchandise.Fujifilm FinePix Z30 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Pink)

Reviews.Title: Great little Fuji
Reviews.Author: Natasha T. Fogle
Reviews.Content: This cute, compact camera is super easy to use and the pictures turn out great. It was hard to tell from seeing the shots on the lcd screen, but once loaded onto the computer, I was pretty impressed. I got this for a super deal on Amazon.com and it was well worth it!

Reviews.Title: SUPER LITTLE CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: GARY SCOTT
Reviews.Content: I PURCHASED THIS CAMERA AS A GIFT FOR MY WIFE.  SHE LIKES IT, BUT I LOVE IT!!!  I USE IT MORE THAN SHE DOES.  IT TAKES SUPER PICTURES, BUT THE VIDEOS ARE A LITTLE SHAKEY.  THAT'S OKAY, CAUSE I BOUGHT IT AS A STILL CAMERA, NOT A VIDEO!!  LOTS MORE FEATURES THAN I FIGURED IT WOULD HAVE FOR THE PRICE.  CANT BE BEAT!!!

Reviews.Title: Great so far
Reviews.Author: B. Merolla
Reviews.Content: We got this camera after our Kodak got sand in the lens mechanism and would not open.  We paid around $110 and feel as though this is a great value for a high quality and easy to operate camera.  The actual product is more high quality in look and feel than the pictures give it justice (looks like a toy in the pictures) and the flip open lens cover to turn the unit on is a nice feature.  The battery is also solid in terms of length of use and quickness to charge.  Works seemlessly with Picasa too, which is nice.  So far we are very happy with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: great cheap camera
Reviews.Author: Tara Houston-mcmillan
Reviews.Content: I already have a nice big camera, but wanted something cheap to carry around when we go to the park and such. I bought a sanyo with the shutters that open and close, they got stuck the first day, so i returned it and got this camera, so far so good. It does suck with everything inside the baterry comparment, and you can't charge with the usb cord, you also have to download there program to use the usb cord. I love that the front slides open with no shutters. So the lens is easy to clean.

Reviews.Title: The perfect camera for kids and beginners
Reviews.Author: Aaron Pressman
Reviews.Content: This hot pink number from Fuji is a perfect, simple camera that takes excellent pictures (and videos with sound) for people who just want to take decent pictures. My daughter loves that sliding the front lens cover turns the camera on and off -- super simple -- and that there's no viewfinder, just a big LCD screen on the back. A good camera for kids and adults who want something drop-dead simple and stylish (from a certain point of view).

Reviews.Title: Great for little kids maybe....
Reviews.Author: C. McColl
Reviews.Content: I sell cameras/camcorders for a living and I have to say that this is one of the worst ones I've come across in a while. While the syle and design might look cool, it is still a camera, and isn't a camera used for capturing important moments? Preserving memories, etc? Then why on earth would you put those things in the hands of something faulty? Yes I am a bit anal when it comes to these things, but it is for your own good I promise.I would only recommend this camera to a young child, as they are really the only ones who might not know better or even care about the quality of the images.  While it is stylish and pocket sized, so are many other cameras of far, far, far better quality than this. First of all, the trendy sliding front piece makes it so your lense never comes out, hence lousy zoom and not much image diversity. The menu is easy to navigate, but again, so are many others in the "point-and-shoot" category. I wish people would open up their minds a bit and embrace technology--it is as if some are just too indimidated by it to venture into something perhaps a bit more complicated (read: sophisticated).  As I patiently tell my customers, a camera should be an investment...not an impulse buy because something is cute or popular.The flash on this thing is awful. It's literally like a sputtering blink that leaves you wondering if it even illuminated anything.  Forget taking pictures indoors with low-light, because you'll just have orange blurs.  There is no image stabilization, (whether it says it has it or not--I promise, try it out, it doesn't.)  I mounted it on a table top tripod and held it still and the pictures STILL had a blur to them.  This is because the camera has a cheaply made sensor that can't capture anything of quality.ONE Okay feature, on most Fujifilm cameras, is the color quality. If you can actually get a clear shot, the color is very nice and vivid. Sometimes so vivid in fact, that it looks like the saturation was upped about +5. This could be a good thing or bad, depending on your situation.  I'm not knocking Fuji's cameras in general--there are some quite nice ones, but do yourself a favor and skip this one. It is more like a colorful toy than a good quality camera.Great cameras in the same price range:  Canon Powershot A480, Nikon Coolpix S220, Sony Cybershot W180.

Reviews.Title: 3rd Finepix Owner
Reviews.Author: S. Ordonez
Reviews.Content: I love Fuji finepix cameras. I've owned 3 of them so far. (One I unfortunately spilt juice on and the other one of my kids dropped and cracked the screen). Each of them has been wonderful. I love the rechargable battery. On this model, you dont get to charge it in the camera. the battery charges on its own. The only downside being that you have to wait to view pictures if your battery is low whereas on the previous model I had, you could plug it in and view/download pics while it was charging.I tried out a bunch of cameras before I bought this third camera. I hate cameras that have a significant delay when you click to take a picture. This camera is fast like all other fujis I've owned. The options are numerous and easy to set up. Easy scrolling to look through pictures.Make sure you have or buy a memory stick with this camera as the internal memory holds about 10 pictures.It's small, light-weight, and has a big viewing screen and easy to use buttons. You wont be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: J. Smith
Reviews.Content: This is an easy to use camera, and it takes great pictures! It required minimal set up, and was ready to use right out of the box. We have had no problems with this camera. The pictures upload easily, and the battery charges quickly. It is practically fool-proof! A great camera for the price!

Reviews.Title: Fuji review
Reviews.Author: E. Antuna "Ester 2010"
Reviews.Content: This is the best buy I have made so far. This nice sleek camera has done more than I could have imagined. Fits in the smallest purses and you still have room for your personal items. LOVE IT!!

Reviews.Title: Faultless fujiZ series
Reviews.Author: Mrs. F. Eveleigh
Reviews.Content: Does exactly what it says it does, looks great too.Nice & compact for nights out & holidays as all the Z series are im on my 3rd upgrade now can't fault them @ all, highly recommend for people who just want a no nonsense point & take photo camera.

Reviews.Title: its awesome!!!
Reviews.Author: ale bellydancer
Reviews.Content: the camera is great! its practically identical to the newest edition of the fujifilm finepix cameras. even has all the same apps and LCD width. its a terrific camera and, personally, i love the designs. some people say it looks childish, but i disagree: its stylish. no one (but my sister who has a similar one) has my camera! and the rubber buttons (or whatever material they are) are much better to feel than the hard buttons of other cameras. it may not be the ideal camera for a pro-photographer, but it suits my needs. i usually only take pictures at family dinners,birthdays,outings with friends, and the usual things like that in life.

Reviews.Title: Daisygirl's Fam Cam
Reviews.Author: Jodi L. Olson "Jodi Olson"
Reviews.Content: Like the way the battery can be plugged into the wall.  The battery lasts a lot longer than normal alkaline batteries.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous Investment for the Money (and the Look)
Reviews.Author: E. T. Barton "Author / Researcher / Book Revi...
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because once I saw the look of it, I had to own it.  It's so pretty - and it's just as cool in person.  As far as features, you definitely need to get an SD Card to go with this since it can only hold about 28 pictures without one (which let's face it, you have to buy SD cards for almost all cameras nowadays).  The menu is a bit basic and the slide feature is a bit old-fashioned in appearance, but it really does get the job done.  It's super lightweight, thin and small, so it's something you don't mind carrying with you everywhere you go.  And the pictures come out fabulously.  I do recommend this to anyone looking for a simple, easy-to-use camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for my kids - quality and lots of fun features
Reviews.Author: Numba
Reviews.Content: My kids got this for christmas -9 and 11 yrs old and love it. It has music to go with the pics and slideshow. Of course they didn't need to read the directions, they just "got it." I was very impressed. My daughters camera seems to be once in a while not want to go on so she has to close the lens for awhile again or push the battery in. I don't know if it's her or the camera yet. But it has been a great gift compared to junk that will get thrown out anyway. And now I get to be in the pictures!

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: Sandra Hamlett
Reviews.Content: Camera is very easy to operate.  My daughter loves the fact that it fits right in her pocket.  Battery does not last a very long time, but is easily charged.

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: Doris J. Haygood "sweetdj"
Reviews.Content: My daughter absolutely love this camera. I got it for her for Christmas and she takes it everywhere. Its auto focus and clear pics are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Ms. Hazel O'rourke
Reviews.Content: I purchased this little camera for my 5 yrs old granddaughter. It is so easy to use, and she loves it. Takes great pics. I would purchase another one.

Reviews.Title: I love my camera
Reviews.Author: S. Arcelay "Steph182"
Reviews.Content: I purchased it because of it simplicity and way to control the kind of picture you wanna take. I really love my camera. The pictures are perfect and have an amazing quality by its price its great too. Its a total girly adolescent digital camera, I'm 21 but to me its great because I don't want more buttons than the one I'm going to use. Totally what I was expecting and loved the White one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Baba "Ann"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 4 and a half year old grandson.  He mastered the basics within minutes. After an hour he was taking pictures, making short videos, setting the timer and posing in pictures with family members, viewing and deleting.  Makes much better sense than the "plastic for little kids cameras". They are not cheap, only use dbl A batteries and do not have quality results.The battery life is good.  He downloads to his mom's mac and she can plug in the battery to recharge when needed.

Reviews.Title: great choice
Reviews.Author: Sergio Chinchilla Guillen "sergionati"
Reviews.Content: I searched for a great, cheap and easy to use point and shoot camera. This camera is awesome, very easy to use, I even bought one for my mother in law!!!

Reviews.Title: great camera, great price.
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera today so I guess I cannot really elaborate on it for long term use but It arrived and I was instantly happy with the results it produced. The screen on the camera does make the photos appear a little grainy but once you put them on the computer the quality is Amazing!! This camera will be replacing my canon Powershot A470. The screen on the back is great because its like glass so you dont have to worry about it getting punctured by being thrown into a pocket or in your purse. I love how it slides open because it instantly powers on when you slide it open and to close it it instantly powers off. This thing is very small but packs a great punch. overall I would recommend this to anyone. I will be purchasing another one of these for a Christmas gift thats how great and highly I think of this camera. =)

Reviews.Title: Great digital camera
Reviews.Author: D. Frew
Reviews.Content: I needed to replace another brand new digital camera which was defective from the outset. After careful research chose the Fuji FinePix Z30. It is durable, well-designed and takes excellent pictures. It has a superior display and functions which are easily deployed. It's also modestly priced for those of us with a more limited budget. I love it

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Sunny Dawn
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this camera and it is exactly as described. The pictures are of excellent quality.

Reviews.Title: Wish I liked it
Reviews.Author: Peggy L. Burkett "PB"
Reviews.Content: I always had a high opinion of Fuji products and maybe it's me.  I want to like this camera. Nice size / design is fine.  But I NEVER know if my pictures will be good or not.  It's like a 50/50 chance.  If I just use automatic and point and shoot, SOMETIMES I get a great picture, but more often than not it is grainy and a horrible quality that I wind up not even keeping.  I wish I knew if it is something I'm doing wrong, but I am NOT at all new to picture taking and usually pride myself on being a pretty good photographer - get lots of compliments on my pictures.  I also have a Kodak Easy Share - but it is a larger camera and with it I get excellent pictures almost 100% of the time.  Again this one - maybe 20% the picture is good.  If I could just figure out what is making it grainy and blurry, I'd be very happy but for now I simply could NEVER recommend this camera to someone.  I think there are much better ones for same price range no doubt.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Pee Wee "AZTWEETIE"
Reviews.Content: I actually bought mine at Sam's Club, but wanted to write a review because I shop Amazon quite frequently.This camera takes good clear pictures.  Have not had any problems at all.  I just love the big view screen, which is nearly the size of the whole back side of the camera.  Easy to download files to computer.  Software setup takes just seconds.One lady said in her review that her screen was totally dead.  I am thinking maybe she got a bad battery.........it happens.  However, I have had nothing but excellent quality with this and battery life is good.  Keep in mind; every time you use a zoom or some of the other features, it takes more of your battery and it may not last as long if you take a lot of zoom photos.  You can also set your camera to not flash for outside photos, which will also save on battery if you don't need a flash for every picture.I suggest you go online to Google and download the pdf instruction file, which is a lot better operation instructions than I received with the camera.  There are several websites....just type in "Fujifilm Fine Pix Z30 operation manual or operating instructions".

Reviews.Title: Worst pictures ever!
Reviews.Author: Shopaholic
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my Sony Cybershot 3.2 MP camera.  I was looking for something small to carry around and this camera had good reviews so decided to try it out.  Big Mistake! .  Every picture I took was grainy.  My Sony takes better pictures and it's 7 years old!  It is small and compact and I love the color but unfortunately the pictures were so bad that I had to send it back.  I think I'll try Sony again.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: This camera has takes great quality photos, they print out looking great too! It's not made for professional photography purposes, but it is ideal for every day use. It has several shooting modes to choose from, there's an energy preservation selection, and face detection. On the battery, I've found that if you actually charge the battery like you're supposed to(charge it before your initial use, and only charge it when it needs to be charged), it lasts! I purchased an additional battery so I wouldn't be without one should the situation present itself, it was only $7 on Amazon.com !Maximalpower DB OLY LI40B/42B Rechargeable Li-Ion Battery for Olympus Li-40B,Li-42B, Kodak KLIC7006,FUJI NP45, Nikon EN-EL10,Pentax D-Li63. Overall, great camera for a great price!

Reviews.Title: Great little point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Richard Dracass
Reviews.Content: This is a great little point and shoot camera to keep in your purse or backpack, or in another handy location. It's super lightweight and ultra thin so it can go anywhere with you. I've had it for about a year and half now, and I have had no problems with it. It takes pretty good action shots, and is fairly fast at taking a shot so you don't miss your opportunity. It doesn't do too well in low light situations when there is movement, but it does as well as I would expect from this price range for a point and shoot. All in all we have been very happy with our camera, I think its a good buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: Vast improvement from FF Finepix J20
Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: My parents were sweet enough and got me a FujiFilm FinePix J20 for my birthday and unfortunately that didn't work out well.  I had a red line in the majority of my pictures so I took it back and got this one and have to say it's so much better. I really like that there is a movie button, unlike the J20 where you had to go into the menu and find it, it's just right at your finger tips.  Also, I love the design and how all you have to do is slide the cover and there it's on!  The pictures are improved and there isn't the blasted 3 second delay like in the J20.  With a toddler, I missed a lot of great pictures because of that delay.There are a couple of things I most definitely would change.  1) the fact that you have to go into the battery/memory card compartment just to plug in the USB cable.  2) Also, I really like that it's unable to zoom in/out while you're video taping.  I've seen in cheaper cameras the ability to do so, so I'm very surprised that this camera doesn't have the ability to do this.Overall, I really, really like this camera!!

Reviews.Title: Pleased with camera
Reviews.Author: Linda Deveso
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera since the end of Aug.Love it, no problems. Nice pictures !

Reviews.Title: Love this little camera!
Reviews.Author: EileenJ
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because my SLR camera is too big to carry when going on certain trips.  This camera is great because I can stick it in my purse. It has so many functions and is very easy to use.  I was very surprised as I didn't expect too much from it but it holds it's own against my SLR and the price was much less.

Reviews.Title: A couple of years old already
Reviews.Author: UtahRecluse
Reviews.Content: This turned out to be a VERY GOOD choice with so many features...yet easy to use.  I took a chance because I had read some negative reviews.....it was 'too cute' for one reviewer.

Reviews.Title: Novelty
Reviews.Author: KarenR
Reviews.Content: It's an ok first camera for a child who doesn't have a cell phone yet.  It does take decent pictures and the design is different so it makes it attractive to children.  Would suggest also purchasing the carrying case that goes with it.

Reviews.Title: bought this a year ago
Reviews.Author: jumbo "jum"
Reviews.Content: i bought this a year ago and its still working just as good as the day i bought it i use this camera heavily bars concerts car shows in the rain although i don't recommend it getting wet sometimes would shut down ,once dry works fine today its beat up and still going strong ,

Reviews.Title: Great Starter Camera
Reviews.Author: Hilary
Reviews.Content: I'm sure it's a great camera, I gave it to my niece for Christmas and she was ALL about it! The only beef I had with the camera is that it was not new as the description implied. It was used, opened, with greasy fingerprints all over it and photos still on the hard drive that I erased. Other than purchasing it from a crappy company, the camera works just fine.

Reviews.Title: A+
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of the better vendors. A+ shopping experience; top quality product; super fast service. I would recommend them without reservation.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix Z30
Reviews.Author: Lee Argus "Orion Lee Argus"
Reviews.Content: The camera is compact. There is a SD/SD-HC compatible slot as well as a 2.7-inch LCD screen, which is quite large considering how small the camera is. The LDC screen displays settings and photos with great clarity during direct sunlight, indoors, and at night.The quality of the pictures are satisfactory. When using this camera, you do need to be aware of what setting will work well for the photo you wish to take. Trial and error.The sliding lens cover functions as both the lens protectant and as the off/ on switch. Once the cover is slid, the camera will take 3 seconds to power on (give or take).The product description states it has a long-life re-chargeable battery. In this case long-life is accurate. If you use it only on the occasion, it will last weeks to 2-3 months.This product only has a 3x optical zoom. There is no optical shake reduction. You'll have to hold steady to take these pictures.If you press Menu< then Shooting Mode< then scroll to Natural & Flash and press the "ok" button, the camera will take 2 image shots continuously; without flash and with flash. Both will be stored for you to later decide which image you preferred; the darker or lighter image.The product comes with a cordless battery charger, which can remain plugged into an outlet. By simply removing the battery out of the camera, then placing it on the charging unit, you're battery will begin to charge. A power indicator light will appear green when the charge is complete. The battery charges quickly.If you select the "Play" button< then select "Menu"< then "scroll down" to Voice Memo> "scroll right"> then select "ok", you will be able to add an audio memo on a still frame image.The nine buttons located near the LCD screen are rubber. They easily click,requiring little force.Below is a compilation of all Actions per button.Menu< Shooting Mode: Manual, Auto, Scene Recognition, Natural, Natural Light, Auction Mode, Portrait, Landscape, Sport, Night (tripod), Sunset, Snow, Beach, Museum,  Party, Flower, Text, Anti-Blur, Successive Movie,Menu< Face Detection< Off/ OnMenu< Image Quality< 10M F 3061 (frames), 10M N 6044,  9 M 3:2 6833, 5M 11787, 3M 18134, 2M 22452, 03M 94300.Menu< Movie Quality< 640 270m55s, 320 436m28sMenu< ISO< AutoMenu< FinePix Color,  Standard, B&W;Menu< High-Speed Shooting< On, OffMenu< Continuous< Off, Long Period, Final 3, Top 3Menu< Set-Up< Image Display, Frame No, Illumination, Digital Zoom, LCD Mode, Date/ Time, Volume, Sound, Blog Image Size, LCD Brightness, Format, Language, Auto Power Off, Time Difference, Background Color, Guidance Display, Video System, Reset.Play<Erase<Timer< 10 seconds, 2 seconds, OffDisplay/ BackDisplay< Playback menu< Erase, Playback Type< All, Still, Blog, Movie,Display< Playback Menu< Trimming for Blog< Effect, Trimming, Rec, Back/ Cancel.Display< Playback Menu< Slide Show< Normal, Fade-In, Multiple, Scrap Book View, Select BGM.Display< Playback Menu< Red Eye RemovalDisplay< Playback Menu<Image Rotate< SelectDisplay< Playback Menu< Protect< Frame, Set All, Reset.Display< Playback Menu< Trimming< selectDisplay< Playback Menu< Copy< Internal Memory to SD Card or vice versa.Display< Playback Menu< Record Voice Memo, Back, Re Record.Transition< Wipe, Slide-In, Fade-In, Off.Display< Playback Menu< Print Order (DPOF)<With Date, Without Date, Reset All.Flash< Forced Flash, Suppressed Flash, Auto Flash, Slow Synchro.In summary; the Fujifilm FinePix z30 10MP is fairly lightweight. It is easy to store it in your pocket without worrying that it will power on. It is roughly the size of my Droid or the iPhone. The sliding lens cover serves its purpose well.The unit has a fast response time and can be operated easily. Its Lithium-ion battery lasts for weeks. It is durable and has survived several falls on various hard surfaces from rough handling by my daughter. The USB cable comes in handy for uploading images onto the computer. A few images may appear grainy on the LCD screen, however, the prints and the transferred images on the computer are not. The camera's sleek black color is consistent. The overall quality is fair.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Sherry A. Williams
Reviews.Content: We have found this camera easier to use, better pictures, and smaller for easier carrying on vacation than the newer models.

Reviews.Title: It's OK...Until...
Reviews.Author: V93
Reviews.Content: This camera was given to me as a birthday gift in 2010 (was NOT bought through Amazon)... I was happy with the camera! I loved the big screen and rubber buttons. The picture quality was ok (sometimes pictures were grainy). On Christmas of 2011 I got my camera out to take a picture of my brother by our Christmas tree...I turn the camera on and all I see is a a white screen. I tried turning it off and taking the battery out then putting the battery back in to see if it worked but it didn't!! I can take pictures randomly without knowing what exactly I am taking a picture of. I have to connect the camera to my computer to see if I like the picture or not!! I am REALLY disappointed :( !! I searched online and other people have had the same problem. Sometimes I randomly turn it on thinking it will magically work again! HAHAHA RIIIIIIIIGHT! I have no clue what the problem is!... By the way I disliked that you are unable to zoom in on videos.

Reviews.Title: Excellent little camera Whirl White design
Reviews.Author: Michele S. Roda
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my kid for Christmas about 3 years ago and she still uses it whenever we go camping, vacation, visits, etc.Compact, convenient, hooks up easily to the computer and it is very attractive. As an adult, I would not mind carrying this around in my purse.The video quality and photos are not bad at all. We have compared identical shots taken with her camera and my more expensive (older too) camera and the colors seem more vibrant with her camera.Very pleased with this little camera and we paid a lot less back than what is advertised at now.

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Jamin Law
Reviews.Content: The item failed to work after a few weeks of use. I returned it to Amazon for a refund. I did not look into the warranty. I don't want to use a product if it fails in the first 30 days.

Reviews.Title: BEST CAMERA I HAVE EVER OWNED (and I've owned a lot)
Reviews.Author: Megan S
Reviews.Content: This Fuji camera has been the best camera I have ever owned.. Sure its only 10 mp and sure it doesn't have the best zoom.  But the pictures are clear, beautiful, crisp, and full of color.. A lot of people complain about the flash on this camera but the flash ALWAYS delivers whether in bright or low light settings.  One of my favorite things about this fuji camera is that it gives the subject of the picture a GREAT skin tone.. I have had too many cameras make family pictures look too pink or yellow, this is just right.  This is the second of the same camera I have owned.

Reviews.Title: Kind of neat camera, more for a teenager.
Reviews.Author: Timothy Bennett "Electronics dreamer t.j."
Reviews.Content: Thought it looked cool and the camera was for the girlfriend anyways and she wanted the fujifilm so i helped out a little.  Once it came, i thought it looked way cooler than the camera's you get at walmart.  I got tired of the look quick because it didn't feel very professional. The screen makes the images of the pictures you took look horrible but once printed they aren't that bad.  4x6 only so 10 megapixels was enough. The colors weren't bad but the pictures weren't any better than my 5 mp camera on my phone but i have a good camera on my phone too lol.  It's very small and a lot of people liked it but we have upgraded since and are upgrading again soon.

Reviews.Title: Grainy Photos
Reviews.Author: Samantha Smith
Reviews.Content: I admit this camera is cheap, small, portable, and relatively easy to use, but the quality of the photos are terrible. So terrible, that I bought a new camera and this one just sits in my room. That's how bad it is. It's such a waste of a $~70 camera. I didn't want to miss out on once-in-a-lifetime photos while I was in Europe, so I didn't even take this camera. It's not a 50/50 chance as one reviewer said. For me, it's a 95% chance that the photo will turn out terrible. I'm not willing to ruin great photo ops with a cheap, poor-performing camera. I wish I hadn't bought it.

Reviews.Title: finepix Z30 photo quality flash opinions
Reviews.Author: cupcake
Reviews.Content: it takes very good photos. the photo flash opinions are: auto flash which takes the photo with flash if it is to dark or if it is the right amount of light it will take the photo with out flash. forced flash shoots with flash in any light condition. slow synchro,and suppressed flash is flash deactivated

Reviews.Title: Grainy
Reviews.Author: teds "teds"
Reviews.Content: Grainy pictures and grainy video even in bright light.  I have had it for over a year now and I wish I had bought something else.

Reviews.Title: Love This Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Liz Severn
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Fuji camera to throw in my purse and carry with me back and forth from Alabama to Arizona. We were building a house, and it was much easier to deal with than my husband's full-sized Nikon when taking update pictures. It takes decent photos, although not as good as digital pictures from a larger, more inclusive camera. Since this is what I expected, it didn't bother me. I used my little Fuji for all kinds of things instead of dragging out the big Nikon. Unfortunately, it was stolen from a hotel. Rather than get a better camera as my husband suggested, I opted for the same little Fuji because I loved it so much. It's a great little camera for grabbing and taking quick pictures, day trips around the area, and just about anything for which one would use a more expensive digital camera. I also love the fact that I don't need a case to keep the camera eye clean and the larger lcd picture frame on the back.

Reviews.Title: what a bargain!
Reviews.Author: soflokid
Reviews.Content: not sure what its selling for now, but at $70 delivered i bought two, one for each daughter. the white with 60's striping is not my bag, but hey, for the money, who cares and the kids like it. its way too feature packed to describe it all here, but man, what a great value.

Reviews.Title: Great while they work.  DOA in a few months
Reviews.Author: G. F.
Reviews.Content: I have now bought THREE of these cameras since December 2009.  I bought a black one and a pink one for my wife and daughter for Christmas.  The black one died in the early Spring.  Fortunately I had purchased a Square Trade Warranty to cover the first death in the family and Square Trade sent me a check for a replacement in just a few days.  I then replaced the black one with an orange one, which has already proven to be a mistake.  Last week, just when we needed the cameras for homecoming pictures, both the pink one and the orange one died.  These two cameras were still under factory warranty, so I had to pack them up and mail them to the Fujifilm repair center in Edison, NJ.  Turnaround time is estimated at a few weeks and the customer service woman at Fuji was gruff and nasty on the phone.  Even worse, after they're repaired I don't expect these cameras to last long after they are returned to us.  Luckily, I got a Canon SD1200IS for Christmas and it has worked flawlessly, so homecoming was not a total loss.When our Z30s have died, they've died suddenly and completely...no power, no nothing.  To make things even worse it has happened with absolutely no warning.  One minute they're working fine, the next you've got nothing more than a $100 paperweight.  Think about how happy you'd be if this happened to you in the middle of a vacation in a remote location (like a national park) where you couldn't readily find a replacement.  Just throw some gingko biloba in your camera bag so you can at least remember what you saw.Consumers reading this review are, of course, welcome to buy whatever camera they want.  Having learned my lesson I'll never buy a Fuji product again.  Don't say you weren't warned.

Reviews.Title: Nice little pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Dave Davis
Reviews.Content: Wow--the price for this camera has really increased.  I bought mine about 8 months ago for less than $80.  This is a great little pocket camera.  It is my "go to" camera when I don't want to lug my Canon XSi and 3 lenses around.  I carry mine in my front shirt pocket and usally have it with me.  I have shot over 3000 pics and most of them come out pretty good.  Obviously, not as good as my Canon, but good enough for it's size.  This year I carried it through 12 days in Europe and 8 days skiing in Colorado.  On both trips I left my Canon at home because in Europe I didn't want to chance it getting stolen, and in Colorado I wasn't going to take my big $800 camera on the slopes.  So this Fuji has gotten a lot of use.  Three things I really like about this camera:  1.  It's small enought to carry around in my pocket, 2.  The slide on the front which protects the lens and turns the camera on.  You simply slide the cover and shoot.  And there's very little delay so you're ready to shoot in about a second.  3.  The battery life is very good and charges quickly.  I'm not for sure I would pay the high price they're asking now, but if you can get it for less than $100 it would be good buy.

Reviews.Title: amazing camera!
Reviews.Author: xsusanx
Reviews.Content: i love this camera. i bought it for my daughter's fifteenth birthday. we took it to new york city with us & it has great battery life, it lasted us all day & we charged it during the evening. i love everything about this camera. the set up is so simple, it takes literally five seconds & is all done on the camera itself. the battery charges very fast & lasts long. the camera is just the perfect size also, it can literally fit in the palm of your hand. i love the simple buttons & sleek design. this camera is very easy to operate. the manual is very easy to read & follow. also, i would definetly buy from this seller again. the camera shipped very fast. even with the standard shipping i ordered we had the camera two days after i placed my order. it is just an amazing camera to use, not too tricky but definetly high quality. it takes very clear & bright pictures, great quality. i love this camera, definetly a smart buy.

Reviews.Title: I Love This Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Jasmine
Reviews.Content: When i puchased this camera, i bought it for a Valentine's Day Special. So i basically paid $80.00 for my camera. Now i see the actual retail price and i can see why it is just that. This camera is very nice and looks better in person. I love this camera. I would reccommend this for anyone. I recieved my package within 2 days. So this camera comes with great services and a wararanty.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but now is too expensive
Reviews.Author: M4rkuz "Marcus Sánchez"
Reviews.Content: I bought this item a few months ago, but I'm impress how much has raise it price I bought it at 69.99 including shipping, Why is so expensive now that I want to buy another?

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great price!
Reviews.Author: Melissa J. Peterson
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera to replace my Nikon Coolpix. I hated my Coolpix, so when I saw the reviews for this camera, and the price, I figured I couldn't go wrong! Takes great pictures and videos, the battery life is fantastic, and the viewer screen is phenominal.

Reviews.Title: FujiFilm FinePix
Reviews.Author: D. Thornton "swub"
Reviews.Content: Great little camera.  Bought this camera for my Mother, who broke her panasonic camera. She's older and this Fuji has a nice big LCD. I can't comment on the battery life, but for how often my folks will use it...I'm sure it will be fine. For under $100, this is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the Cost
Reviews.Author: The Preventer
Reviews.Content: I like the easy functioning of the camera. The only glitch I had was loading the software on my laptop. The cd that comes with the camera only had software compatibility up to Windows Vista and of course, I would have Windows 7. It was remedied by going onto Fuji's website, pulling up the link for updating the software to Windows 7, installing it and everything has been working fine ever since.

Reviews.Title: fujiifilm finepix-good buy
Reviews.Author: R. White
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera about a month ago and I have taken approximately 100 pictures. the pic quality is good. the camera is very easy to use. it has a fast recovery time and has a continuous mode that is good for taking taking a series of pics. very good battery life. All in all a good cheap point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Good but could be better
Reviews.Author: Adriana Casadiego P "Adriana"
Reviews.Content: Hi!  I recently purchased the camera and I can tell you that the product is good for the price that you are paying.  There are some things that aren't as good as I'd want to, like the night pictures and the time it takes to shoot.  Anyway, if you need a simple, nice and not advanced machine, I believe this one is just ok.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Softmystic
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my daughter for Christmas. She has 3 children, ages 16, 4, & 1. Now I get more photos of the grandchildren. She loves it. Says it is easier to carry around with her and takes great photos.

Reviews.Title: Wife loves it
Reviews.Author: Traveler76
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife for Christmas. She loves the compact size and easy to use features. The camera feels solid and is very responsive. Only negative I've noticed is that the quality of pictures in low light is lacking somewhat. Keep your subjects close in low light and it will be OK.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Moore II
Reviews.Content: for the price i felt this camera has the best quality my neice deserves thankyou.

Reviews.Title: Great value camera
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline M. Gentzel
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It is small and stylish. It also takes really good pictures!! The only downside is that the screen is a bit grainy, but this does not affect the pictures at all! Great value!

Reviews.Title: fuji pink
Reviews.Author: Natasha L "grench73"
Reviews.Content: This camera is of pretty good quality & actually did better than I thought it would... I should have gotten two because I did get a pretty good deal.

Reviews.Title: Fuji camera
Reviews.Author: Dragonfly Girl
Reviews.Content: This camera looked so much better in person than it did in the picture.  The picture are good and it is easy to operate.  It was bought for a teenager so it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: Good design but pictures are worthless
Reviews.Author: Z. Greenwood
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my mom for christmas.  I charged it and tested it for her and I feel bad about giving this to her.  It takes the most grainy pictures I have ever seen on a digital camera and I have owned about 5 over the years.  I thought technology was supposed to get better not worse?  Don't pay attention to the megapixel claim it is just a marketing gimmick, my old 3.2 megapixel digital camera took better photos than this.  I am returning to Amazon for a refund and I am going to buy her a better camera.  I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Easy and Fun!!!!
Reviews.Author: Steff
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera.  It is super cute and compact.  I bought it because I needed something small to keep in my purse.  Fuji has never disappointed!  This will be my 4th Fuji camera and I will never use another brand...The pictures are clear and sharp, there are a ton of different features.Have fun!

Reviews.Title: Just right
Reviews.Author: Deborah Defilippo
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my grandson's birthday.  What lead me to this were the colors available.  His favorite is orange.  Went to a local superstore to check it out.  It seems to have everything an 8-year old could need, ie: ease of use, batteries, large viewing screen.

Reviews.Title: Good value for the price
Reviews.Author: Laura Campbell
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on a whim, after getting fed up with the grainy pictures that my older Nikon model camera was producing. Overall, I am very pleased with my purchase. The small internal memory is my only complaint, but this was easily fixed by purchasing an inexpensive memory card. I have used the camera inside and out, in many different situations and it continuously produces fine-quality images. They are easy to upload with the included USB cord as well. The camera's buttons may be a little small for some, but the camera is easy to navigate and get the hang of. I would recommend the Fujifilm Finepix Z30 to anyone looking for a small, fun, inexpensive camera.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: I.V.
Reviews.Content: just got it delivered. so far i LOVE IT! got it for only $107 on sale, AWESOME price for the quality. i haven't received the memory card yet, but since this cam. has some extra space on it, i was able to take a great picture of my baby. and i LOVE the zoom option!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: T. Smith
Reviews.Content: This camera is very sleek and compact. I love how the slide cover protects the lense while the camera is off, so that I never have to worry about scratching or getting dirt in the lense. The LCD display is grainy, but pictures with good lighting come out great. I've had some trouble with getting good nighttime pictures though. It takes amazing close-ups of flowers! Overall, a great intermediate/beginner camera!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for a young teen
Reviews.Author: Hali
Reviews.Content: It is perfect for a young teen but thats about all. I thought I was buying a better camera but I was wrong. Quality of the pictures are fuzy and off color. The program that came with it does not work. I have to use my old software that went to my easyshare camera (which is so much better wished I never gave it away). I even had my stepfather (who is a photographer and works on cameras)look at it to see what was wrong but got the same quality of photos. If you are looking for a camera and you do not want to take cheap looking pictures do not buy this. We are going to sell this one to my mother-in-law for a 13yr old girl's birthday gift. A good starter for someone who has never owned one and does not know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: more than expected
Reviews.Author: Ramy Eman
Reviews.Content: already i have casio ex-z700 with almost twice this price 3 years ago.i didn't expect it will strike it away.its feel is very lovely, very smart in design.con:the menu graphics/resolution is low

Reviews.Title: really great camera
Reviews.Author: T. Ching
Reviews.Content: This is a review for those on the fence about this product. As of now, it's on sale at Amazon for a really good price. There isn't another like this camera that has as much quality for it's price. The camera is very sturdy, simple to use, and effective. The look on this camera is simply gorgeous. I bought the white swirl version of the Z30, and it really does look nice (and not feminine as I thought it might). Though there isn't a lens window and only an LCD screen, it's not much a of a drawback for me - though i can understand if others would want this feature. The LCD screen itself is conveniently large, and at the refresh rate that the camera gives, it's simply stunning to see in motion. Because the refresh rate is very high, it also produces top notch images. However I do need to mention that this camera is NOT powered on AA batteries but on Lithium batteries, which may bother some. However Fujifilm supplies this camera with 1 Lithium battery and 1 charger with the camera itself, so it really is not an issue for me. Also while viewing the pictures it moves unexpectedly slowly while browsing at full screen, so one might have to view all pictures as an album to effectively skim through the photos already taken. Again, not much of a deal breaker.This camera also was much much smaller than my previous one (Canon powershot a460) and much more efficient. If you are unsure about this product, and willing to pay the amount amazon offers, I suggest you buy it. The sale on amazon will not last (as there are only 9 and counting on sale), and there really isn't a better deal out there.Pros:10.1 megapixel camera produces high refresh rate and great imagessmall but yet sturdyVery appealing to just...stare atPackaged with lithium battery and chargersimple to use, yet with a lot of options for those wanting moreCons:uses Lithium instead of AAslow browsing speed of photos takenonly LCD viewing screen, no traditional camera viewer

Reviews.Title: fuji z30
Reviews.Author: Johnny L. Scott
Reviews.Content: awesome camera. turns on instantly so we can catch the kids being goofy before the spot us. bought an extra battery but it just sits on the chareger, the one that comes with it lasts forever. great camera.

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: Roberto Colmenares
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera for the value. I bought it for mi wife and she is very happy with it.The color of the pictures is very bright, and the panel in the back is bigger than most cameras.It is not PLASTIC, like the cameras in the same range value, so the battery and memory holder will last for a long time.

Reviews.Title: CHEAP AND GOOD, ITS WORTH IT!
Reviews.Author: A. Villalobos "AMAZON QUEEN, LOL"
Reviews.Content: I BOUGHT THIS CAMARA 2 WEEKS AGO FOR MYSELF, AND I DO NOT REGRET IT. IT TAKES PERFECT PICTURES AND IT HAS ALOT OF PICTURE ADJUSTMENTS. THE ONLY DOWNFALL IS THAT IT IS VERY SMALL, BUT IS SO SMALL THAT ITS CUTE AND MAKES IT DIFFERENT AND UNIQUE FROM THE OTHERS. I BUY ALOT OF AMAZON PRODUCTS AND THIS IS THE BEST PRODUCT I BOUGHT YET. GOOD LUCK I HOPE MY REVIEW HAS HELPED YOU. I FORGOT TO ALSO ADD THE SOFTWARE IS EASY TO INSTALL AND ITS EASY TO UNDERSTAND. GOOD LUCK GUYS I HOPE YOU BUY THIS PRODUCT. :-)

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Annie Isley
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for valentines day from my boyfriend. I love it. Its cute and so little I can take it anywhere and fits in your pocket if needs be!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Caitlin Murdock
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because of it's small size. It is easy to carry in my purse or in my pocket. It doesn't take the best quality pictures, but it's not bad. It's easy to use and easy to load the pictures onto my computer. Overall, it's a good camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Impressive Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Lhora-lyne Garcia "Mommy of 2 Boys"
Reviews.Content: The fujifilm finepix z30 is all that i could want in a camera....takes great pictures, I also like the fact when you review the pictures you can view it as a slide show and music is incorporated in it.  my only regret is i should have bought the water proof finepix..

Reviews.Title: gooberforgood
Reviews.Author: Clayton B. Ranney
Reviews.Content: This is my seconed camera. Lost the first one out of my kayak. Should of had a chain around my neck. Havean't thried this one jet. Not worried.Clayton

Reviews.Title: fun little toy
Reviews.Author: Robin Doronn
Reviews.Content: I love the compact size with the huge view finder.  very easy to use.  fits well in purse or pocket

Reviews.Title: Compact budget camera
Reviews.Author: Anurag Chauhan
Reviews.Content: I would like to divide review in two parts:1) Camera:  a very stylish and slim camera with nice features. One thing i didnt like was the video capture feature. i wasnt able to find any option to pause the video capture. I got the white whirl one, it looks cool and clicks nice. Startup time is real short and auto mode works nicely. Navigation is strange as well as the buttons placement, however it works.Please note the contents of the shipping included battery with charger as opposed to what is written in description of item.Make it doubly sure before you get this one.2) Amazon shipping: it took 4 days for them to actually ship it then more 7 days  to reach me. I was not able to track the shipment as USPS doesnt update anything on website. I got a mail that your shipment is at nearest post office when it was given to my apartment office.Bottom line: Get the camera but make sure that its not USPS shipping the item.

Reviews.Title: Cost Effective
Reviews.Author: T. Htoon ">>>[Amazon]<<<"
Reviews.Content: Got what I paid for.Pros: CheapCons: Not so good in terms of quality.Others: For the price, I got this. That's more than enough :)

Reviews.Title: Just how you described it.
Reviews.Author: J. Gaona
Reviews.Content: This product was packeged and delivered successfully.  It performs extremely precise to the standards it was given by the seller. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: continuing solid service from Amazon
Reviews.Author: E Boyd
Reviews.Content: Shipping was quick and arrived in time for Christmas as promised.  Packaging was intact and appropriate. Everything I expect when I order from Amazon. Product worked right out of the box and was a perfect Christmas gift.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for 89.99
Reviews.Author: H. Gress
Reviews.Content: Bought the White One when it was first released about a week and a half ago, For the price its actually a pretty nice camera but, kind of unreliable on the photos it takes some come out ok and some don't. Some of the photos had bubbles in them. Over all its a ok basic point and shoot camera but I will be returning mine tomorrow, not really what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: For teenagers
Reviews.Author: newbie
Reviews.Content: Best camera for the female teenagers or children. Cute, feminine, tiny, cheap (I bought white). As good as it is gets for them. The lens opener seems a little unsturdy. The quality of pictures and video not as good as you would get for more professional $200-300 cameras. But hey... I will carry it in my purse every day for this price.wanted to add:I've owned this camera for 6 months now. Have 1000s of pictures. I also have another old fujifilm camera 5 mgpxls. The same pictures with the same settings are not even close, the old one is soooo much better. I feel that i purchased one of this plastic disposables... Sorry but unless it cost $50 it has no value to it, sorry you guys who left good reviews, you probably did not have good cameras before and not necessarily very expensive

Reviews.Title: as birds say:  "cheap cheap cheap"
Reviews.Author: R. Palmquist "simpson luva"
Reviews.Content: This is my first actual digital camera that wasn't attached to a phone/video camera/etc., and i was excited to be getting it. Well, I've had my fujifilm for about a month an a half now, and it was really nice until a couple weeks ago, when a good chunk of plastic fell off. Now, i don't treat my camera like royalty, and I'm a student, so i often put it in my backpack with  my all my other necessities, however i do have a nice bag for it, and never dropped it more than a few inches, so this was a surprise to me. And now, for some reason, when I turn my finepix on, there are a bunch of blinking white lines across the screen, and if i leave it on long enough in this condition, the screen goes completely white. So, i tried to rescue this camera myself, so i unscrewed the plastic back, (which was very difficult because in addition to the 4 phillips head screws, there is one 3-notched screw on the bottom, that none of my screwdrivers would easily fit into) and picked up the screen that had some sticky stuff on the back, which was messing with the connection to the lens, and viola! all was well. Then the next day the same thing happened. only this time it was spoaratic. My warranty is still valid, and I am considering returning it, but doing so would cost me more money, and time. And this may be a one time thing, but I don't want to wait until my warranty expires to fine out. do yourself a favor. Get a canon.***EDIT***I sent my camera in, and since there are some miniscule cracks on the cheap plastic covering of the camera and the battery door, fujifilm REFUSES to fix it, they think i caused the internal damage. They want $53, nearly what i paid for the camera. So today I bought an olympus digital camera from goodwill for $6 that already works better. DO NOT BUY FROM FUJIFILM.

Reviews.Title: Battery sucks!
Reviews.Author: Nizam Ahmad
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and send it to my brother as a gift. But the only complain so far is its battery does not charge....;-( SO he had to purchase a separate battery again.

Reviews.Title: Always Open that battery door!!
Reviews.Author: Mr. Sergiy Shpak "lenin20002"
Reviews.Content: BAD- if you wana download pics you need to open battery door. (connector is inside. and i download pictures very often)- if you wana recharge battery you need to open battery door to pull the battery out (i expected it can be recharged with USB)- if you wana get or put memory, you need to open battery door...I think that door is gona DIE in 2-3mnthGOOD- nice looking- has manual mode- nice looking- 10 Mp- good movie modes- do i need face detection..(not mention the camera is nice looking)

Reviews.Title: The fujifilm z30 on the first day
Reviews.Author: Joey Bumbalough "jowen"
Reviews.Content: I just received my camera yesterday and it will not turn on. I tried both batteries that came with the bundle and it still will not turn on. I'm going to return this one and upgrade to either a canon or nikon. The fujifilm looks alright but seems to be cheaply made. Even if it did turn on, I dont think this camera would last very long.

Reviews.Title: One of the Worst
Reviews.Author: Jane Doe
Reviews.Content: My daughter's point of view (age 13):When I first saw this camera at the store i was absolutely sure I was going to love it. I wanted it to take pictures of my friends and other things since my graduation was coming up. Almsot everything was right the color, it was a fujifilm and my friends had fujifilms that took excellent pictures. So when I bought it and took it home I was so wrong.Cons:1. grainy pictures2. crammed buttons3. Software is kind of crappy4. Looks very cheap. It looks like it is made out of plastic5. My LG Dare takes way better pictures than this! and its 3.2 megapixel.Pros:1. small size2. great color and glossI was really disappointed with this camera and took it back the next day. To whoever who is looking to buy this camera don't waste your time or money. BUY A KODAK!!

Reviews.Title: Don't condeme Fuji or Amazon.
Reviews.Author: N. Pisani
Reviews.Content: A Amazon email landed me on the Fuji Z30.  I checked the reviews and I always read the worst one first. And then a few of the "good" ratings reviews. Well after a lifetime in professional photography and 10 years retail cameras sales, this last review is typical. And is way off base. Some one buys a product, it is defective, but do they take it back right away? No they sit on it for 30+ days.  Returning two items to Amazon. I followed their return policy and had no problems.  I returned ( had in the mail) 2-3 days after I got the items. I purchased knee braces. I ordered one size- too small. The next size  was too big. I started amazon's return immediately. Amazon accepted the returns and credited my charge card. What did this experience tell me? Don't order clothing items from on line vendors! It's not Amazon's fault, but my odd size. Now lets talk about Fuji. I have a the Fuji S20 Pro ($1500.00  & a few years old). One day, I pick up the camera and 1/2 of the screen is blank. I called Fuji, not the place I bought it! Fuji said that is sounded like a sensor defect, please send the camera in. I did that. Long story short, Fuji fixed the camera as it was in fact a defect that they took responsibility for. All it cost me was $8 for shipping to Fuji and I had an out of warranty camera repaired at no charge. Now of course this is not the norm for out of warranty repairs, but Fuji could have charged me and I would have not known the difference or they could have told me to "take a long walk on a short bridge".  The moral of my story find out the return policy of retailers and follow it quickly. For service try to deal direct with manufacturers. They normally go out of their way to helpful.

Reviews.Title: Dont Buy...Terrible!!!!
Reviews.Author: cbernardo
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the reviews, this camera stinks bad.  Very grainy, terrible quality.  No zoom during video also.

Reviews.Title: Fuji Camera
Reviews.Author: Toni R. Radmann
Reviews.Content: This camera is not worth the $149 retail value that it claimed, less than half the value.  This was no bargain.  I will not be trusting or ordering items from you again.
